chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric Espinoza was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

3/7/17 - Plea and Sentencing Hearing

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #1
Extended Supervision Conditions-ordered by the court

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney S Hoelzel.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  PSI waived.  Court imposes a total sentence of 2 years WSP concurrent to Racine County case 16CF12:  1 year initial confinement; 1 year extended supervision w/conditions; deft is eligible for CIP/SAP; deft to submit DNA sample and pay $250 DNA surcharge.
With Atty Hoelzel the STC of 2/17/17 at 1:15pm is rescheduled, as the deft is unable to be writted here from RCJ as he has court in Racine; reset to 3/7/17 at 3pm.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Atty S Hoelzel appeared on behalf of deft.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Hoelzel states the deft is in the Racine County Jail and has a sentencing in Racine on 2/17/17 at 10:30am; has just received an offer from the State.  STC continued to 2/17/17 at 1:15pm.  Bond continued.
Atty  Sally Hoelzel
Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Atty K Watson appeared on behalf of deft.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft was not writted.  Atty Watson's motion to withdraw is granted.
to withdraw as counsel of record; filed by Atty K Watson.

With Atty Watson and by agreement of ADA Drees the STC of 11/4/16 at 9:30am is rescheduled; as resolution of his case here is dependent on his cases in Racine which have another court date in December; reset to 1/24/17 at 8:45am.

With Atty Watson and by approval of the court, the STC of 9/21/16 at 1:15pm is rescheduled, as Atty Watson is trying to work out an offer w/the State and the deft has cases set for sentencing in Racine on 10/25; reset to 11/4/16 at 9:30am.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney K Watson.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Watson requests to remove the JS from 7/18/16 and schedule a STC in September, deft has pending cases in Racine and the outcome there could affect the State's offer in this case.  Court removes the JS of 7/18/16 at 8:30am and sets a STC on 9/21/16 at 1:15pm.  Bond continued.
And demand for discovery - filed by ADA  C McNeill.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney K Watson.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Watson requests to adjourn trial date as the deft has court in Racine on the same date.  Court grants adjournment of trial from 6/6/16 at 8:30am to 7/18/16 at 8:30am, JSH continued to 7/14/16 at 1:15pm.  Bond continued.
Jury status hearing on May 16, 2016 at 08:15 am.
With Atty Watson the time of the JSH on 5/16/16 at 1:15pm is changed to 8:15am, due to a conflict w/the court's calendar.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney K Watson.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Case is not resolved.  JSH 5/16/16 at 1:15pm and JS 6/6/15 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Atty K Watson appeared on behalf of deft, who did not appear.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Watson states the deft is incarcerated at the Racine County Jail.  FPT continued to 2/5/16 at 8:45am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney K Watson.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Watson states she needs to discuss case w/ADA McNeill.  FPT continued to 1/13/16 at 8:45am.  Bond continued.
Final pre-trial at 12-04-2015 08:15 am
With Atty Watson the FPT of 12/1/15 at 8:30am is rescheduled, due to a conflict w/a trial proceeding on this date; reset to 12/4/15 at 8:15am; Atty Watson to attempt to notify deft.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

Defendant, Eric Espinoza, appeared with Attorney Kristyne Watson.  Attorney Carli A. McNeill appeared for the Prosecution.     Clerk JThwing. Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found. Bound over to Br 6.  Information filed, reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Bond continued.  DA Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 1, 2015 at 08:45 am.
